tag_list: searchrev, tracking-net, online-advertising, netscape, aol, yahoo, akqa
overview:
After spending 15 years in the database and operating system fields, David entered the internet arena joining Netscape in 1996. There, he headed teams working on Server products and the Netcenter portal. Following the merger with AOL, David became VP of Product Development for the Netbusiness small business unit. David then joined Yahoo and headed up the Production team for the Autos, Yellow Pages, Classifieds, Real Estate, Maps and Search Advertising properties. In 2003, David co-founded SearchRev, a Search Engine Marketing company, which was sold for over $25mm to AKQA in 2007.

Since 2008, David has been busy inventing the first true server-side tag execution engine with his startup, Tracking.net.
